underlying_goal: The user wanted to create robust, secure, and user-friendly shell scripts to copy and paste files over SSH.
primary_success: After creating the initial scripts, Claude (with the help of a sub-agent) identified and fixed a critical shell injection vulnerability, making the final tool much more robust and secure.
brief_summary: The user requested `ssh-pbcopy`/`paste` aliases. Claude evolved this into standalone, cross-platform scripts (`rcopy`/`rpaste`) with help text and symlinks for alternate names. A code-reviewer agent then found a critical shell injection vulnerability, which Claude fixed before committing and pushing the final, secure tools.
